alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:13PM EDT until July 15 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT FOR BERKELEY, CHARLESTON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 1109 PM EDT, law enforcement agencies in Charleston and Dorchester Counties indicate numerous roads remain flooded and closed in the North Charleston, Ladson, Hanahan and Summerville areas and water has entered some homes and businesses. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain fell in these areas earlier this evening. Additional rainfall will be light. No additional flash flooding is expected, however it will take awhile for flood waters to subside. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Crowfield Plantation, Lincolnville, Greggs Landing, Middleton Place, Oakbrook, Summerville Medical Center, Archdale, Cooke Crossroads, Dorchester Estates, Centerville and Stallsville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
